Synthesis Method: Induction melting at 1300 °C under Ar, cast in copper mold, cooled under Ar; as-cast ingot via copper mold casting
Key Findings: Alloy shows 1.68 wt% H₂ storage at 25 °C, operates 0–50 °C and 1–40 bar, elastic modulus ~198 GPa (macroscopic) to 269 GPa (ultrasonic).; Elasto‑plastic behavior with mean elastic modulus ~198 GPa; strong microscale heterogeneity observed in SEM and nanoindentation.; Nanoindentation identified four domains with elastic moduli 265–384 GPa; macroscopic compression modulus 163–229 GPa; composition variations across domains.
Comments: Mn addition reduces defects, enhances H diffusion and kinetics.; Compression and nanoindentation tests reveal heterogeneous microstructure and variable elastic response.; First detailed mechanical study of this TiFeMn alloy.
